results.title: Galileo: the challenge of reason
results.creator_credit: Dennis Azzarella and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Examines the life of Galileo, humanist and founder of modern experimental science, who, because of his unorthodox belief, was brought to trial before the Inquisition in 1632. It establishes a contemporary theme in the confrontation between an individual and the Establishment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis Azzarella and Learning Corporation of America

results.title: The Galaxy in the sea
results.creator_credit: Dietmar Fill, Don Murray, George Hart, Klaus Jaritz and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A microscopic look at the Barrier Reef. Shows many of the 350 species of coral plus a variety of fish, sea slugs, and the fascinating Spanish Dancer.

results.title: Galaxy
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: An experimental film using firework images, sometimes superimposed and sometimes in very soft focus. The mystery of outer space is evoked, its blackness broken by shooting stars and meteor trails, gaseous clouds and solar configurations. The sound track has reversed and slowed down triangle and cymbals added to an accelerated piano and xylophone.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: The Galapagos: Darwin's clues
results.brief_description: Shows how the variety and characteristics of the wildlife of the Galapagos Islands provided the first clues for Darwin’s theory of natural selection.

results.title: Future shock
results.creator_credit: Alex Grasshoff and Metro Media Corporation
results.brief_description: Examines the current phenomenon of future shock, the condition which results from too much change too fast. Current technological developments are presented through interviews with scientists. The film echoes Alvin Toffler’s questioning of whether or not change is necessary, and if it is out of control.

results.title: Furniture Craftsman
results.creator_credit: Edwin James Hipkiss and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: The work of designers and craftsmen in manufacturing “custom built” furniture. Pattern-making, laying out, band-sawing, power planing, joining, lathe turning, grooving, glueing, carving and finishing, as well as the relation between hand-tool operations and machine-tool operations are dealt with in detail.

Pattern-making, laying out, band-sawing, power planing, joining, lathe turning, grooving, glueing, carving and finishing, as well as the relation between hand-tool operations and machine-tool operations are dealt with in detail.

results.title: Furnishing is fun
results.brief_description: How an average family in 1961, whose children have grown up, refurnishes the home. Shows the range of furnishings available in Australia, the advisory services, especially colour consultants and gives some indication of costs involved. Narrated by Gordon Bell and scripted by Burton Graham.
